text: Abul Qasim Muhammad Badruddoza Chowdhury (11 October 1930 – 5 October 2024) was the 13th President of Bangladesh, serving from 14 November 2001 until his resignation on 21 June 2002. He was the founding secretary-general of Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP). He was also a known physician, and former cultural activist, an author, essayist, playwright, television presenter and an orator of distinction.
